author: JuliaRegistrator

comments.body:
Your `new package` pull request does not meet the following guidelines for auto-merging:

- Name does not meet all of the following: starts with an uppercase letter, ASCII alphanumerics only, ends in a lowercase letter. **Important note: It is okay to have a package name that ends in an uppercase letter. However, you will need to wait until a registry maintainer manually approves the name.**
- Name is not at least five characters long
- Version number is not 0.0.1, 0.1.0, or 1.0.0
- The following dependencies do not have a compat entry that has an upper bound: julia. You may find [CompatHelper](https://github.com/bcbi/CompatHelper.jl) helpful for keeping your compat entries up-to-date.Note: If your package works for the current version `x.y.z` of a dependency `foo`, then a compat entry `foo = x.y.z` implies a compatibility upper bound for packages following semver. You can additionally include earlier versions your package is compatible with. See https://julialang.github.io/Pkg.jl/v1/compatibility/ for details.

Note that the guidelines are only required for the pull request to be merged automatically. However, it is **strongly recommended** to follow them, since otherwise the pull request needs to be manually reviewed and merged by a human.

---
If you want to prevent this pull request from being auto-merged, simply leave a comment. If you want to post a comment without blocking auto-merging, you must include the text `[noblock]` in your comment.
<!-- [noblock] -->
<!---
this_is_the_single_automerge_comment
--->
Unfortunately that's already taken by https://github.com/roberthoenig/FirstOrderLogic.jl and I'd prefer to avoid the clash!

>  I'd prefer to avoid the clash!

That package is not registered in the General registry, so there'd be no clash if users were to `] add FirstOrderLogic` (that said, still the potential confusion if users land upon that repo).

Yup, I understand, but `FOL` provides considerably different functionality (it's essentially a Prolog port), and I'd feel bad given that the other package is older and claimed the name first.

I'd prefer a shorter name, so keeping `FOL` would be great, but otherwise I'd also consider `Julog` (Julian Prolog) or `Predicated` (after predicate calculus).
@ztangent `Predicated.jl` seems like a good name to me!
@ztangent I'll close this PR, and then you can make a new registration after you have renamed the package to `Predicated.jl`.

@DilumAluthge @nickrobinson251 on reflection I personally think `Julog` would a better package name that communicates what this package provides (i.e., Prolog-like functionality in Julia), whereas its unclear what `Predicated` means, it'd be great if we could go with that instead.

body:
